newsitem.title: SWEDEN: N.America helps Astra H1 sales up 13 pct.
newsitem.headline: N.America helps Astra H1 sales up 13 pct.

text.p: Swedish drug company Astra AB said on Friday that its sales rose 13 percent in the first half of 1997 with North American markets showing the strongest growth while European markets were mixed.
The company posted a pre-tax profit of 7.01 billion crowns ($874.1 million) in the first six months, a four percent rise from a year ago while its sales reached 21.47 billion crowns.
Astra said in a statement that its sales in Europe rose slightly to 11.66 billion crowns from 11.22 billion crowns a year ago, a rise of one percent at constant exchange rates.

Sales rose nine percent in Germany, eight percent in Italy and 12 percent in The Netherlands but slipped 14 percent in Britain mainly as a result of parallel trade and fell 22 percent in Sweden, largely due to stockpiling.
In North America sales rose to 6.33 billion crowns from 4.81 billion crowns which Astra said, calculated at constant rates, was a rise of 18 percent.
"A large part of the group's sales growth is now derived from North America, where several of Astra's products are expected to have substantial further potential," Astra said.
Market expectations were for a six percent rise in pre-tax profit of 7.18 billion crowns.
